title: Arthur Janov - The Anatomy of Mental Illness
description:
Review from Amazon by John DeLullo on October 17, 2010:

Finally a book of psychology that deals with the physical aspects of mental illness.It explains in detail how trauma from childhood is stored and integrated throughout the biological system and how this stored pain reverberates within the subconscious to effect thought and behavior.It also explains how this stored pain causes physical ailments such as cancer, diabetes, and heart disease. Unlike most psychology books it gives detailed scientific explanations of how trauma from childhood affects the mind (as well as the body)and how to reverse its effects. Very scientific, but easy to read and understand. Despite its age the information contained in the book is still relevant. If only the scientific community would accept the concepts contained in this book it would revolutionize the study of both psychology and medicine. A definite MUST READ!


Title	The Anatomy of Mental Illness: The Scientific Basis of Primal Therapy
Author Arthur Janov
Publisher	G.P. Putnam's Sons
Publication Date: 1971
ISBN	0349008361, 9780349008363
Length	253 pages
